data.title: The Clerks Mallrats connection
data.text:
Please don't moan if you've already known this but I've got somethin'

I wanna point out.

I've jsu seen two of the coolest movies ever, Clerks and Mallrats.

Haven't seen chasing Amy yet, but it looks like the best of the three,

buy I'm curious about these aspects.-

So Randal is Brodies cousin, judging by the fact that they have the

same perverted Cousin Walter. Why don't they appear in a movie

together, their both my favourite characters from both of these films

(excluding Jay & Silent Bob). Also, what happened to the actor who

played Randal, he was cool. I know Jason lee (Brodie) went on to star

in Chasing Amy, but what happened to Randal?

The actor who played Dante made a brief appearance in the movie as

the third suitor on the game show. Why didn't he play Dante, is it

some rule by Kevin Smith?

They both mentioned that girl (forgot her name) who died in the

swimming pool. In Clerks they visited her wake, and in Mallrats she

was mentioned as T.S was the cause for her death.

Rick Whatsisface (guess what I've forgotten his name) he was seen in

Clerks mentioning to Dante how he screwed Caitlain behind his back.

And in Mallrats he was mentioned when T.S and Brodie were talking to

the rather gorgeous Gwen about when SHE screwed him.

Oh and when T.S and Brodie are hiding in the Flea Market, and when

Brodie is looking through the comics on one stall, I saw T.S try on a

cap, not just any cap, a Clerks cap. I want one. And when he saw what

it was he frowned and threw it back on the table.

Are there any links like that in Chasing Amy, and is anyone else from

Clerks and Mallrats (excluding Jason Lee, Ben Affleck and Jay and

Silent Bob (can't be arsed to write their names, its easier to refer

to them as their character names)) Hmm, thats enough bracketed off

sentences for now. So long and SNOOTCHIE BOOTCHIES!

"All it took was a phat chronic blunt!"

JAY. Mallrats.

In article <35c4e8f7...@news.which.net>,

Arse...@bigfoot.com (Andrew ) wrote:

> Please don't moan if you've already known this but I've got somethin'

> I wanna point out.

>

> I've jsu seen two of the coolest movies ever, Clerks and Mallrats.

> Haven't seen chasing Amy yet, but it looks like the best of the three,

> buy I'm curious about these aspects.-

It depends. "Amy" IS a good movie, but I was disappointed when I first saw

it because it had some very serious and emotional themes, whereas 'Rats and

Clerks were both straight-up comedies, and that was what I was expecting from

Amy. It is a good movie, but you have to remember it isn't as comedic and

satirical as 'Rats and Clerks.

> So Randal is Brodies cousin, judging by the fact that they have the

> same perverted Cousin Walter. Why don't they appear in a movie

> together, their both my favourite characters from both of these films

> (excluding Jay & Silent Bob). Also, what happened to the actor who

> played Randal, he was cool. I know Jason lee (Brodie) went on to star

> in Chasing Amy, but what happened to Randal?

Jason Lee is also starring in Kevin Smith's new movie "Dogma." He will be

playing the role of Azarel.

You have to bear in mind that Kevin wanted to make a New Jersey "trilogy,"

telling three different stories, and that they have a chronological order.

I believe that Jeff Anderson (Randal) will be in Smith's upcoming Dogma, too.

> The actor who played Dante made a brief appearance in the movie as

> the third suitor on the game show. Why didn't he play Dante, is it

> some rule by Kevin Smith?

Brian O'Halloran <sp?> is the guy who played Dante. In 'Rats he played Gil

Hicks, who is probably meant to be Dante Hicks' cousin. He didn't play

Dante, however. In the scheme of the movie's chronology, Dante was probably

trying to patch things up with Veronica and comfort Caitlin; ergo, his

character was unavalible for 'Rats.

> They both mentioned that girl (forgot her name) who died in the

> swimming pool. In Clerks they visited her wake, and in Mallrats she

> was mentioned as T.S was the cause for her death.

Julia Dwyer.

> Rick Whatsisface (guess what I've forgotten his name) he was seen in

> Clerks mentioning to Dante how he screwed Caitlain behind his back.

> And in Mallrats he was mentioned when T.S and Brodie were talking to

> the rather gorgeous Gwen about when SHE screwed him.

Rick Derris.

> Oh and when T.S and Brodie are hiding in the Flea Market, and when

> Brodie is looking through the comics on one stall, I saw T.S try on a

> cap, not just any cap, a Clerks cap. I want one. And when he saw what

> it was he frowned and threw it back on the table.

More than likely, a "Clerks" cap is avalible through Jay and Silent Bob's

Secret Stash, on the web. Check out www.viewaskew.com

> Are there any links like that in Chasing Amy, and is anyone else from

> Clerks and Mallrats (excluding Jason Lee, Ben Affleck and Jay and

> Silent Bob (can't be arsed to write their names, its easier to refer

> to them as their character names)) Hmm, thats enough bracketed off

> sentences for now. So long and SNOOTCHIE BOOTCHIES!

Well, Joey Lauren Adams (who played Gwen in 'Rats) returns as Alyssa, the

object of Ben Affleck's affections. She is Tricia Jones' (Trish the Dish

from 'Rats) sister. There are refernces also to Brandy Svenning (T.S.'

girlfriend in 'Rats) and Rick Derris, as well as a brief mention of Julie

Dwyer, and a few references to Clerks and Caitlin's institutionlization.

That's all that I can think of off the top of my head, but I think that there

are a few more scattered references to 'Rats and Clerks. Many of these

happen pretty early-on in the movie, shortly after Affleck's character

(Holden) meets Joey Lauren Adams' character (Alyssa).

> "All it took was a phat chronic blunt!"

> JAY. Mallrats.

-----== Posted via Deja News, The Leader in Internet Discussion ==-----

http://www.dejanews.com/rg_mkgrp.xp Create Your Own Free Member Forum

Timeline:

VA Timeline:

late Thursday, early Friday: Walt Flanagan's Dog

Late Friday: Mallrats

Saturday: Clerks

Clerks the Comic happens in an imbiguous time, between Clerks and Amy

(TheMissing: Shannon Hamilton milk carton suggests that he escaped from

prison, proving that it's after Mallrats, and it's obvious why it's before Amy)

Directly Prior to Amy: Jay and Silent Bob #1

+- Two years after Clerks: Chasing Amy

Since Holden and Banky are the same age as all the other male leads, but out of

college (They did go to college, as noted in Banky's "Jaws" scene), it's about

two years later. They could be older, but all the related characters suggest

they're not. (Cohee, Derris, Julie Dwyer, Brandi, Gwen)

You guys also forgot a few crossovers. Most people won't accept the fact that

the two Willams are indeed the same character, but Kev has said that they are.

Also, In Amy, there are two easy-to miss crossovers. Outside of the Hockey

rink, Alyssa admits to Holden about having sex with Shannon Hamilton and Gwen

Turner, the two characters Ben Affleck and Joey Lauren Adams played in

Mallrats. Also, Dunn & Reddy Home Improvements is located in the same apartment

building as Bank Holdup Productions.

Jay and Silent Bob Mini 2, 3, 4

Dogma..

In article <35C7B9...@dial.pipex.com>,

Neth <maa...@dial.pipex.com> wrote:

> jim.mo...@montego.com wrote:

> >

> > It depends. "Amy" IS a good movie, but I was disappointed when I first saw

> > it because it had some very serious and emotional themes, whereas 'Rats and

> > Clerks were both straight-up comedies, and that was what I was expecting

>

> Yeah, "Amy" kinda disappointed me too. Sure, it was a great movie, but a

> little too slushy in places following the no-holds-barred styles of Clerks

> and Mallrats. Joey Lauren Adams was v.good, as were Ben and Jason, but Banky

> was a fairly undeveloped character who could have been a lot more. Also, Jay

> & Silent Bob could have had longer roles.

Yeah, it seemed that the main theme of the Banky character was "homophobe

sexist." But that was about it. And I was personally disappointed by Banky

mainly BECAUSE he was such a homophobe. Like Brodie and Randal, Banky was

more or less the obnoxious smart-ass, but Banky was too hatefilled to be

genuinely funny.

And yeah, Jay & SB could have had a better role. I remember hearing that

they had a great scene in "Amy" but unfortunately, that scene came much too

late into the movie. I missed "Clerks" and "'Rats" because Jay and S&B had

much more screen time and were involved in a lot of the comedy. But still,

it was a great scene.

> Still, at least it didn't have a pat-happy ending in the way Mallrats did,

> and it was still a very funny and touching (without being touchy-feely)

> movie.

Well, Mallrats was concieved to be a lighthearted comedy. I loved the ending

of "Amy" since it WASN'T pat-happy.

> Snoogins,

> Neth



The actor that played Randal, the video clerk(in Clerks) supposedly had a

falling out of some sort w/Kevin Smith.

x wrote in message <01bdcbdc$7b52a7a0$92fdadcf@default>...
